page.title: 07COUNTRY SPORTS,BIBURY
page.content: These sports take place in and around Bibury. The Hunt meets four times a week from November to April. The field is led by the field master. The huntsmen and officals wear hunting pink, farmers and landowners wear black jackets. Approximately eighty four brace of fox are killed. The hunt is supported by subscription. Bibury court shoot of eight hundred acres is privately owned and keepered by one man,who rears pheasant and partridge.Fifty percent of the birds are shot over a period of seven days shooting.The shot birds are sold for human consumption.Dry fly fishing begins in April on the River Coln,which is stocked with brown and rainbow trout.The average weight of fish caught is approximately two and half pounds. The coarse fish are taken out, and sent to coarse fishing clubs.
